translation.text: Maaroo, Third Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: By Your Grace, please unite with Your devotees.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: Your devotees ever praise You, lovingly focusing on You.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਤਉ ਸਰਣਾਈ ਉਬਰਹਿ ਕਰਤੇ ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਆ ॥੧॥

translation.text: In Your Sanctuary, they are saved, O Creator Lord; You unite them in Union with Yourself. ||1||

transliteration.text: tau saranāī ubarah karatē āpē mēl milāiā .1.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: Sublime and exalted is devotion to the Perfect Word of the Shabad.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: Peace prevails within; they are pleasing to Your Mind.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਮਨੁ ਤਨੁ ਸਚੀ ਭਗਤੀ ਰਾਤਾ ਸਚੇ ਸਿਉ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾਇਆ ॥੨॥

translation.text: One whose mind and body are imbued with true devotion, focuses his consciousness on the True Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: man tan sachī bhagatī rātā sachē siu chit lāiā .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: In egotism, the body is forever burning.

translation.text: When God grants His Grace, one meets the Perfect Guru.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਅਗਿਆਨੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਬੁਝਾਏ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The Shabad dispels the spiritual ignorance within, and through the True Guru, one finds peace. ||3||

transliteration.text: antar agiān sabad bujhāē satigur tē sukh pāiā .3.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: The blind, self-willed manmukh acts blindly.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: He is in terrible trouble, and wanders in reincarnation.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਜਮ ਕਾ ਜੇਵੜਾ ਕਦੇ ਨ ਕਾਟੈ ਅੰਤੇ ਬਹੁ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੪॥

translation.text: He can never snap the noose of Death, and in the end, he suffers in horrible pain. ||4||

transliteration.text: jam kā jēvarā kadē n kātai antē bah dukh pāiā .4.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Through the Shabad, one's comings and goings in reincarnation are ended.

translation.text: He keeps the True Name enshrined within his heart.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੈ ਸਬਦਿ ਮਰੈ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਰੇ ਹਉਮੈ ਜਾਇ ਸਮਾਇਆ ॥੫॥

translation.text: He dies in the Word of the Guru's Shabad, and conquers his mind; stilling his egotism, he merges in the Lord. ||5||

transliteration.text: gur kai sabad marai man mārē haumai jāi samāiā .5.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Coming and going, the people of the world are wasting away.

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਥਿਰੁ ਕੋਇ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥

translation.text: Without the True Guru, no one finds permanence and stability.

transliteration.text: bin satigur thir kōi n hōī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਬਦਿ ਸੁਖੁ ਵਸਿਆ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਆ ॥੬॥

translation.text: The Shabad shines its Light deep within the self, and one dwells in peace; one's light merges into the Light. ||6||

transliteration.text: antar jōt sabad sukh vasiā jōtī jōt milāiā .6.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸੇਵੇ ਤਾ ਮੁਕਤੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਪੰਚ ਦੂਤ ਵਸਿ ਆਇਆ ॥੭॥

translation.text: Serving the True Guru, one is liberated, and the five demons are put under his control. ||7||

transliteration.text: satigur sēvē tā mukat hōvai panch dūt vas āiā .7.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਭੇਟੇ ਸਚੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾਏ ਸਚੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਇਆ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Meeting the True Guru, Truth is implanted within, and the True Name becomes pleasing to the mind. ||8||

transliteration.text: satigur bhētē sach drirāē sach nām man bhāiā .8.

translation.text: Singing the Glorious Praises of the True Lord, in the true melody, I am immersed and absorbed in Truth. ||9||

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਓਥੈ ਸੋਗੁ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਨ ਵਿਆਪੈ ਸਹਜੇ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਇਆ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: There, one is not afflicted with sorrow or separation; merge into the Celestial Lord with intuitive ease. ||10||

transliteration.text: ōthai sōg vijōg n viāpai sahajē sahaj samāiā .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The evil people live in the love of duality.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: They wander around, totally attached and thirsty.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਕੁਸੰਗਤਿ ਬਹਹਿ ਸਦਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਵਹਿ ਦੁਖੋ ਦੁਖੁ ਕਮਾਇਆ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: They sit in evil gatherings, and suffer in pain forever; they earn pain, nothing but pain. ||11||

transliteration.text: kusangat bahah sadā dukh pāvah dukhō dukh kamāiā .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: Without the True Guru, there is no Sangat, no Congregation.

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਬਦੇ ਪਾਰੁ ਨ ਪਾਏ ਕੋਈ ॥

translation.text: Without the Shabad, no one can cross over to the other side.

transliteration.text: bin sabadē pār n pāē kōī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਹਜੇ ਗੁਣ ਰਵਹਿ ਦਿਨੁ ਰਾਤੀ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਆ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: One who intuitively chants God's Glorious Praises day and night - his light merges into the Light. ||12||

transliteration.text: sahajē gun ravah din rātī jōtī jōt milāiā .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: The body is the tree; the bird of the soul dwells within it.

translation.text: It drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar, resting in the Word of the Guru's Shabad.

text: ਉਡਹਿ ਨ ਮੂਲੇ ਨ ਆਵਹਿ ਨ ਜਾਹੀ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: It never flies away, and it does not come or go; it dwells within the home of its own self. ||13||

transliteration.text: udah n mūlē n āvah n jāhī nij ghar vāsā pāiā .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Purify the body, and contemplate the Shabad.

translation.text: Remove the poisonous drug of emotional attachment, and eradicate doubt.

text: ਆਪੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਕਰੇ ਸੁਖਦਾਤਾ ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਆ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: The Giver of peace Himself bestows His Mercy, and unites us in Union with Himself. ||14||

transliteration.text: āpē kripā karē sukhadātā āpē mēl milāiā .14.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਦ ਹੀ ਨੇੜੈ ਦੂਰਿ ਨ ਜਾਣਹੁ ॥

translation.text: He is always near at hand; He is never far away.

transliteration.text: sad hī nērai dūr n jānah .

translation.text: Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, realize that He is very near.

text: ਬਿਗਸੈ ਕਮਲੁ ਕਿਰਣਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੈ ਪਰਗਟੁ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਾਇਆ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: Your heart-lotus shall blossom forth, and the ray of God's Divine Light shall illuminate your heart; He shall be revealed to You. ||15||

transliteration.text: bigasai kamal kiran paragāsai paragat kar dēkhāiā .15.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: The True Lord is Himself the Creator.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਆਪੇ ਮਾਰਿ ਜੀਵਾਲੇ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਕੋਈ ॥

translation.text: He Himself kills, and gives life; there is no other at all.

transliteration.text: āpē mār jīvālē avar n kōī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਵਡਿਆਈ ਆਪੁ ਗਵਾਇ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ॥੧੬॥੨॥੨੪॥

translation.text: O Nanak, through the Naam, the Name of the Lord, glorious greatness is obtained. Eradicating self-conceit, peace is found. ||16||2||24||

transliteration.text: nānak nām milai vadiāī āp gavāi sukh pāiā .16.2.24.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.
